security_audit.summary: This is a documentation skill for MCP server development. All 593 static findings are FALSE POSITIVEs: markdown code blocks triggered 'backtick execution' alerts; official MCP documentation URLs triggered 'hardcoded URL' alerts; UUIDs and version strings in docs triggered 'weak cryptographic algorithm' alerts. The Python scripts (connections.py, evaluation.py) use official MCP libraries for legitimate stdio transport configuration. No malicious behavior confirmed after manual review. Previous audit also rated this as 'safe'.

content.user_title: Build MCP Servers with Best Practices
content.value_statement: Create secure, efficient MCP servers that enable AI agents to interact with external APIs and services. Follow proven patterns for tool design, error handling, and evaluation.
actual_capabilities: Guides building MCP servers in Python (FastMCP) and TypeScript (MCP SDK)
Provides complete implementation examples with code patterns
Includes evaluation framework for testing MCP server effectiveness
Offers security and authentication best practices
Supports multiple transport types: stdio, HTTP, SSE
limitations: Requires programming knowledge to implement servers
External API integration needs proper authentication setup

prompt_templates.title: Basic Server
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a basic MCP server in Python that can search for users. Include proper tool naming, Pydantic validation, and error handling.

prompt_templates.title: API Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Build an MCP server for GitHub API integration. Show tools for searching repos, creating issues, and managing PRs with rate limiting.

prompt_templates.title: Evaluation Testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an evaluation test suite with 10 realistic test cases to verify Claude can use my MCP server tools effectively.

prompt_templates.title: Production Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through deploying an MCP server in production with OAuth authentication, input validation, and monitoring.

output_examples.input: Create an MCP server for Slack integration
output: Tools for sending messages, listing channels, searching users
Proper error handling and rate limiting
Evaluation test suite with 10 test cases

output_examples.input: How do I name my MCP tools?
output: Use service-specific prefixes: github_create_issue not create_issue
Follow verb_noun pattern for actions: search_users, get_file
Keep names lowercase with underscores for readability
Be descriptive about what the tool returns

output_examples.input: What transport types does MCP support?
output: stdio: Local process communication via standard input/output
HTTP: Web-based server with REST-like interface
SSE: Server-Sent Events for real-time streaming
Choose based on your deployment scenario

best_practices: Use service-specific prefixes in tool names to avoid conflicts
Implement both JSON and Markdown response formats for flexibility
Add proper annotations (readOnlyHint, destructiveHint, idempotentHint) to all tools
Follow the evaluation-driven development approach for continuous improvement
anti_patterns: Don't create tools that simply wrap single API endpoints without workflow consideration
Avoid returning excessive data that overwhelms the context window
Never skip input validation or error handling
Don't ignore the CHARACTER_LIMIT when returning large datasets

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: The guide covers Python (FastMCP) and Node/TypeScript (MCP SDK) implementations.

faq.question: How do I test my MCP server?
faq.answer: Use the included evaluation framework with XML test cases to verify tool effectiveness.

faq.question: What transport types are available?
faq.answer: MCP supports stdio, HTTP, and SSE transports for different deployment scenarios.

faq.question: How do I handle authentication?
faq.answer: The guide covers OAuth, API keys, and secure credential management for service integration.

faq.question: What is the difference between tools and resources?
faq.answer: Tools perform actions and operations while resources provide static data access via URI templates.

faq.question: How do I prevent tool name conflicts?
faq.answer: Always use service-specific prefixes like github_create_issue instead of generic names.
